text: Create the game setup and user interface
Design the layout of the game screen
Plan the placement of game elements and controls
Create visual assets for the interface components
Implement the game background and environment
Add buttons and interactive elements for user input
Configure menus and game start screens
Apply styling and visual effects to interface elements
Test the interface layout for usability and clarity
Implement player connection and lobby creation
Establish a server to handle incoming player connections
Create a method for players to connect to the server
Implement a handshake or authentication process for new connections
Develop a system to detect when players join or leave
Create a lobby creation feature that players can initiate
Set up a way for players to specify lobby details (e.g., name, max players)
Store lobby information in a data structure accessible to the server
Allow players to join existing lobbies or create new ones
Update lobby status when players join or leave
Notify players of lobby updates and connection statuses
Generate and manage unique game room codes
Create a function to generate a random code with a fixed length
Ensure the code is unique by checking it against existing room codes
Store the generated code in a database or data structure that tracks active room codes
Implement a system to validate the code when a user tries to join a game room
Provide a way to delete or mark a code as invalid when the game room is closed
Allow players to join existing game rooms
Identify the existing game rooms that players can join
Create a user interface element for players to see available game rooms
Implement functionality to display the list of available game rooms to players
Allow players to select a game room from the list
Validate that the selected game room exists and is joinable
Add logic for the player to send a join request to the selected game room
Update the game room data to include the new player
Notify the other players in the game room about the new joiner
Confirm to the player that they have successfully joined the game room
Start the game when all players are ready and set the initial cards for each player
Handle card play actions with socket.io event listeners
Establish a socket.io connection between the client and server
Set up event listeners for card play actions on the socket connection
Define a callback function to handle incoming card play events
Update the game state or UI to reflect the played card upon receiving the event
Send an event to notify other players about the card play action
Ensure proper disconnection handling and error management for socket events
Validate card plays (game started, correct room, player's turn, card ownership)
Check if the game has started
Verify the player is in the correct room
Confirm it is the player's turn
Ensure the player owns the card they want to play
Update game state by adding cards to discard pile and removing from players' hands
Identify the cards to be added to the discard pile
Remove the selected cards from each player's hand
Add the identified cards to the discard pile
Update the game state to reflect the changes in players' hands and discard pile
Apply card effects and manage turn progression
Determine the active player's card effects to apply
Apply the effects of the active player's cards to the game state
Check for any resulting changes or triggers from the applied effects
Update the game state accordingly based on the applied effects
Advance to the next player's turn or phase as appropriate
Notify players of the turn progression and any new conditions or effects
Implement UNO button functionality for players with one card and detect violations to assign penalty cards
Determine and display the winner when a player has no remaining cards
Check if the player has no remaining cards
Identify the current player in the game
Verify if the current playerâ€™s card count is zero
If the player has no remaining cards, declare the player as the winner
Display a message indicating the winner's name or identification
Prompt players to play another game after a round
Integrate digital tokens (digipogs) for in-game currency transactions before gameplay
